intro: Canthium cambodianum, commonly known as the Cambodian spurge, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
